programme.title: Champions League Final 1993
programme.desc: We revisit the 1993 final between Marseille and AC Milan at Munich's Olympiastadion. The occasion was later overshadowed by one of the biggest scandals in the sport's history.

programme.title: Champions League Final 1994
programme.desc: A look back at the extraordinary 1994 final at the Olympic Stadium in Athens between Fabio Capello's AC Milan and Barcelona, managed by Johan Cruyff and dubbed the 'Dream Team'.

programme.title: Champions League Final 1995
programme.desc: We revisit the 1995 final in Vienna between Louis van Gaal's Ajax and AC Milan. A star-studded Ajax team featured Edwin van der Sar, Ronald and Frank de Boer, and Edgar Davids.

programme.title: Champions League Final 1996
programme.desc: We revisit the 1996 final between Ajax and Juventus in Rome. Juve's talented side included Didier Deschamps, Antonio Conte and Gianluca Vialli - all at the height of their powers.

programme.title: Champions League Final 1998
programme.desc: Real Madrid went in search of their seventh European Cup title when they faced Juventus in the 1998 final in Amsterdam. The Serie A winners featured a 25-year-old Zinedine Zidane.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2001
programme.desc: We revisit the dramatic 2000/01 UEFA Champions League final between Bayern Munich and Valencia at the San Siro in Milan. Bayern were chasing their first title in a quarter-century.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2003
programme.desc: We revisit the 2002/03 UEFA Champions League final between Juventus and AC Milan at Old Trafford. Paolo Maldini aimed to lift the trophy as captain, just as his father did in 1963.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2004
programme.desc: We revisit the 2003/04 UEFA Champions League final between Monaco and Porto in Gelsenkirchen. Jose Mourinho would leave Porto to take over at Chelsea just days later.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2007
programme.desc: We rewind back to the 2006/07 UEFA Champions League final at the Olympic Stadium in Athens as AC Milan looked to avenge their defeat two years previously against the Reds.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2009
programme.desc: A look back at the 2009 UEFA Champions League final between Barcelona and Man Utd in Rome. United were bidding to become the first team to defend the trophy in the modern era.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2010
programme.desc: We revisit the 2010 UEFA Champions League final between Bayern Munich and Inter Milan at the Bernabeu. Jose Mourinho was looking to become the third man to win it with two clubs.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2013
programme.desc: We revisit the all-German 2013 UEFA Champions League final between Borussia Dortmund and Bayern Munich at Wembley. Bayern had lost two finals in three years.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2015
programme.desc: We revisit the enthralling 2014/15 UEFA Champions League final between Juventus and Barcelona in Berlin. Barcelona were chasing their third Champions League title in six years.

programme.title: Barcelona v Man Utd 1994/95
programme.desc: We revisit the 1994/95 UEFA Champions League group stage tie between Barcelona and Man Utd at the Nou Camp. Johan Cruyff's 'Dream Team' featured Hristo Stoichkov and Romario.

programme.title: Man Utd v Barcelona 1998/99
programme.desc: We revisit the 1998/99 UEFA Champions League group stage epic between Man Utd and Barcelona at Old Trafford. This end-to-end game featured six goals, two penalties and a red card.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Georgia is looking for a football-playing Cara Delevingne. Josh and Natasha bond over having fabulous hair, but commit some hilarious dining faux pas.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Neuroscientist and self-confessed geek Michael is yet to find someone with the right kind of chemistry. His date Hannah hopes that her dream man exists outside her romance novels.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The Goggleboxers watch Michael McIntyre's The Wheel, Love Is Blind, Strictly Come Dancing, Boiling Point, HELP! My House Is Haunted, and All Creatures Great and Small.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The Greek at the Harbor: Gordon Ramsay helps a family-run Greek restaurant turn its fortunes around in Ventura Harbor in California. But he uncovers a shocking family secret.

programme.title: The Tiger Who Came to Tea
programme.desc: Animated, fun-filled adventure based on the classic story by Judith Kerr. Sophie and her mummy are having tea when a tiger arrives at their door and eats them out of house and home.

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: As the villagers reel from a shocking turn of events, the McQueens are on different paths and the Hutchinson family fall apart. Meanwhile, will a star-crossed couple be drawn back together?

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: Cheeky clips from Rude Tube's naughty little sister Rude(ish) Tube, featuring weddings, space and sci-fi fans.

programme.title: We're Going On a Bear Hunt
programme.desc: Wrap up warm and step into the snow for a wonderful animated adventure based on the bestselling bedtime book by Michael Rosen. Voiced by Olivia Colman, Pam Ferris and Mark Williams.

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Nathan loves music and Stoke-on-Trent, so when bride-to-be Beccie gives him free rein to organise their wedding, he plans Northern Soul nuptials.

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: After a hilltop proposal, hopeless romantic Gavin plans nuptials in Somerset for his fiancée Sophie, with a combined theme of farmyard and Thai. Is he aiming too big and too high?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Michon's: Gordon Ramsay visits a family-run smokehouse in Atlanta. Can Gordon help the unwell owner address his daughter's hands-off management style?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Zocalo: Gordon Ramsay visits a floundering Mexican restaurant which has become an albatross around the necks of its owners, married couple Greg and Mary Russell.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Spin a Yarn: Gordon Ramsay tries to save the struggling Spin a Yarn restaurant. Despite an expensive refurbishment, the business is tearing apart its owners' marriage.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Pilot: The first episode of the Emmy-winning comedy, shot from the perspective of an unseen documentary maker. It's not easy being part of a family these days...

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Bicycle Thief: Phil is determined to help Luke show his mum that he's responsible enough to have the new bike they just got him, but Phil ends up being the irresponsible one.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Coal Digger: The family are invited to Jay and Gloria's for a barbecue and football, but an incident at school between Manny and Luke makes things awkward for Gloria and Claire.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Run for Your Wife: It's the first day back at school for the kids and, at the Dunphy house, Phil oversteps when he misreads how Claire is coping with an empty nest.

programme.title: The Great New Year Bake Off
programme.desc: Grab a dram, as Scottish bakers from across the years celebrate Hogmanay in the tent! Whose Technical will fall short? And whose cranachan will see them crowned as 2025's first star baker?

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Lizard-Spock Expansion: Howard is furious when a woman who he likes falls for Leonard instead, despite Howard's efforts to woo her.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The White Asparagus Triangulation: Sheldon is delighted that Leonard has finally found a girlfriend who matches up to his high standards... Perhaps a little too delighted.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Vartabedian Conundrum: Leonard goes to Penny for help when his relationship with Stephanie takes off faster than he'd like, but will he act on her advice?

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Bath Item Gift Hypothesis: At Christmas, Leonard's hunky colleague starts dating Penny, while Sheldon's obsession with gift-giving etiquette torments everyone.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Cushion Saturation: A game of paintball leads to a squabble when Penny accidentally shoots paint at one of Sheldon's cushions. Romance blossoms between Howard and Leslie.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Terminator Decoupling: Leonard, Sheldon, Howard and Raj discover that beautiful sci-fi actress Summer Glau is on board their train to San Francisco.

programme.title: The Simpsons Movie
programme.desc: (2007) Animated comedy. When Homer's love for a pig causes world-threatening pollution, Springfield gets enclosed in a huge dome. D'oh! Will he do the decent thing and save his neighbours?

programme.title: The Inbetweeners Movie
programme.desc: (2011) Comedy with Simon Bird, Joe Thomas, Blake Harrison and James Buckley. School is over, so the boys celebrate with an outrageous lads holiday in Crete.

programme.title: Open House: The Great Sex...
programme.desc: ...Experiment: Couples test whether open relationships and sex with other people can strengthen their bond. Will a couple's first sexual experience with an outsider go to plan?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: On the box this time: I Can See Your Voice, Emmerdale, Strictly Come Dancing, Unbreakable, The Ex-Wife, Bargain Hunt and BBC/ITV News (new Chancellor).

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Self-confessed 'dating disaster' Katie from Bristol wants to turn her luck around. Student James has a thing for heels and glitter, and hopes to meet an open-minded guy.

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Fitness fan Rose feels her body's getting all the attention, and her love life's struggling. Basingstoke barista Clarissa seeks her dream woman. Will the naked pods bring joy?

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Spring Break: At spring break, Claire starts spring cleaning, while Phil realises he's no spring chicken when Luke starts outperforming him at what seems like everything.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Grill, Interrupted: Jay's birthday brings everyone together and Phil is beside himself over the super cool gift he got Jay: a high-tech outdoor grill.

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: As the villagers reel from a shocking turn of events, the McQueens are on different paths and the Hutchinson family fall apart. Meanwhile, will a star-crossed couple be drawn back together?

programme.title: We're Going On a Bear Hunt
programme.desc: Wrap up warm and step into the snow for a wonderful animated adventure based on the bestselling bedtime book by Michael Rosen. Voiced by Olivia Colman, Pam Ferris and Mark Williams.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: It's New Year's Eve. The Hutchinsons wake to find Ro unconscious, and things don't get any better for the family... Elsewhere, will a nudge help to pull a star-crossed couple back together?

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: As the Hutchinsons fall apart, Tony has some bad news for Diane. Donny keeps a close eye on Abe. And a lost teen receives an unexpected invitation.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Spin a Yarn: Gordon Ramsay tries to save the struggling Spin a Yarn restaurant. Despite an expensive refurbishment, the business is tearing apart its owners' marriage.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: House Mouses: Peralta insults Hitchcock and Scully's work ethic, so they try to get involved in a dangerous investigation in an attempt to prove themselves.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Adrian Pimento: The precinct gets a new detective who's coming away from a 12-year undercover assignment with the Mob. Gina directs a video for Captain Holt.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Tornado, a Ten-Hour Flight and a Darn Fine Ring: Sheldon and Mary visit Germany. The rest of the Cooper family brave a tornado heading straight for Medford.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Wiener Schnitzel and Underwear in a Tree: The new and final series commences! In the first episode, news of the tornado reaches Sheldon and Mary in Germany.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Codpiece Topology: Seeing Penny out on a date with another guy sends a distressed Leonard rushing back to Leslie Winkle, much to Sheldon's dismay.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Barbarian Sublimation: Penny becomes addicted to an online game based on the world of Conan the Barbarian and begins to pester Sheldon for advice.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Queer Eyes, Full Hearts: Phil and Claire don't know if they should be happy that Haley and Andy are spending time together. They soon find out that things are not as they appear.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Three Turkeys: Phil is cooking Thanksgiving dinner this year with Luke as his sous chef. But Claire has no confidence in them and prepares a secret turkey of her own as backup.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Agreement Dissection: Priya uses her legal expertise to dissect the roommate agreement and put Sheldon in his place, and the girls take Sheldon dancing.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Wildebeest Implementation: Raj attempts to overcome his anxiety about talking to women, while Penny uses Bernadette to spy on Leonard and his girlfriend.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Engagement Reaction: Howard finally tells his mother that he's engaged to Bernadette. Unfortunately, the news lands his mum in hospital.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Roommate Transmogrification: Raj decides to move in with Sheldon after hearing Leonard and Priya engaging in a Star Trek bedroom fantasy.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Coral Palms (Part 3/3): The team go on a road trip to help Peralta and Holt take down crime boss Jimmy Figgis but their plan is hindered by an unforeseen injury.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The Night Shift: Holt looks for ways to improve the team's morale, while Santiago is filled with curiosity when Diaz starts to take long breaks from her desk.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Closet? You'll Love It!: Jay and Claire scramble to shoot a Pritchett Closets commercial in response to their competitor's new advert, but there might be some creative conflict.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Knock 'em Down: Jay agrees to join Cam's bowling team for the finals, but doesn't realise that he's not eligible to play in the league.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Community Service and the Key to a Happy Marriage: Meemaw gets assigned a tough probation officer, and Georgie takes marriage advice from his father-in-law.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Little Snip and Teaching Old Dogs: George Sr is worried Mary wants another baby, so he gets a secret vasectomy. Linkletter and Sturgis ask Sheldon for help.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Rothman Disintegration: Sheldon and Kripke argue over who should get Professor Rothman's vacant corner office. Amy buys Penny some art to celebrate their friendship.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Werewolf Transformation: Sheldon's well-organised world is turned upside down when he learns that the barber who has cut his hair for years is ill in hospital.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Weekend Vortex: Amy is upset when Sheldon breaks his promise to attend her aunt's birthday party in order to join the guys for a Star Wars video game marathon instead.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Beyond Blunderdome: Mel Gibson hires Homer to help him rewrite his remake of Mr Smith Goes to Washington.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: A suspicious new wife does some investigating, but what will she discover? Ro continues to struggle with Arlo's sinister taunts. And everything gets too much for a young dad.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: We Need to Talk About Lily: Phil thinks he's found Pepper's dream home. Mitch and Cam get invited to an exclusive event.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart Stops to Smell the Roosevelts: Superintendent Chalmers' unconventional approach to teaching Bart about US history sparks a fascination with President Teddy Roosevelt.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Treehouse of Horror XXII: A venomous spider's bite leaves Homer paralysed, Flanders is transformed into a cold-blooded vigilante, and Bart and Milhouse visit a distant planet.

programme.title: News
programme.desc: The leading news stories of the moment.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout
programme.desc: (2018) Tom Cruise stars in part six of the action-thriller series. His mission: to stop terrorists from getting their hands on nuclear bombs and unleashing global devastation.

programme.title: The Lighthouse
programme.desc: (2019) Oscar-nominated psychological horror starring Willem Dafoe and Robert Pattinson. A pair of lighthouse keepers dangerously descend into insanity on a remote island.

programme.title: The Double
programme.desc: (2013) Dark psychological thriller. Jesse Eisenberg stars as a timid man whose drab existence takes a turn for the worse with the arrival of a new colleague at work. With Chris Morris.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid: The Long...
programme.desc: ...Haul: (2017) Family comedy sequel. A Heffley family road trip to attend Meemaw's 90th birthday party hits the skids, thanks to Greg's hare-brained scheme to cram in a gaming convention.

programme.title: Earth vs the Flying Saucers
programme.desc: (1956) Sci-fi thriller. Hugh Marlowe stars as a scientist who discovers Earth is threatened by a fleet of flying saucers bent on global conquest. With special effects by Ray Harryhausen.

programme.title: The Karate Kid
programme.desc: (1984) Kung fu thriller with Ralph Macchio and Pat Morita. Elderly handyman Mr Miyagi teaches new-kid-at-school Daniel how to stand up to the school bully. It all hinges on the crane kick.

programme.title: 10 Things I Hate About You
programme.desc: (1999) Teen comedy with Julia Stiles and Heath Ledger. A student is furious to discover her prom date was bribed by her sister to invite her. But confusion ensues when he falls for her.

programme.title: We Live in Time Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Andrew Garfield and Florence Pugh - along with director John Crowley - talk about making the Film4-backed romantic drama We Live in Time.

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: (2016) Action-comedy with Dwayne Johnson and Kevin Hart. Two former school buddies team up to thwart a terrorist plot. But things may not be as they seem. With Amy Ryan and Jason Bateman.

programme.title: Cowboys & Aliens
programme.desc: (2011) Sci-fi western starring Daniel Craig and Harrison Ford. A brutal cattle baron and his amnesiac enemy must cease their feuding when a town is attacked by aliens.

programme.title: Bad Boys
programme.desc: (1995) Action comedy with Martin Lawrence, Will Smith and Téa Leoni. Can two cops catch a drugs lord, keep a witness alive and fend off Internal Affairs?

programme.title: Pet Sematary
programme.desc: (2019) Horror based on Stephen King's novel. Seeking a quiet life, a family moves to a rural setting. But there's a road with speeding trucks and a pet cemetery that resurrects the dead...

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Dora and the Lost City of Gold
programme.desc: (2019) Family adventure with Isabela Moner, Eva Longoria and Michael Peña. Everyone's favourite young explorer must track down her parents, who are missing in Peru.

programme.title: Daleks Invasion Earth 2150 A.D.
programme.desc: (1966) A sci-fi classic with Peter Cushing. Dr Who travels to the future only to find the Daleks have conquered the Earth! Can he stop them nuking the planet's core? With Bernard Cribbins.

programme.title: Secret Headquarters
programme.desc: (2022) Family comedy with Michael Peña. A young lad discovers that his lax dad is in fact a superhero. Then, with no time to process, he must foil a villain's plot to bring his daddy down.

programme.title: The Seeker: The Dark Is Rising
programme.desc: (2007) Supernatural thriller. Alexander Ludwig stars as The Seeker, who has the task of finding six items hidden throughout time, which the scary forces of The Dark are also looking for.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: Lively debate and discussion with our panel of paper reviewers about the stories making tomorrow morning's newspapers.

programme.title: Road to Perdition
programme.desc: Period crime drama starring Tom Hanks and Paul Newman. The Midwest in the 1930s: when the profession of ruthless hitman Michael Sullivan is discovered, a killer is sent to eradicate him and his family. But Sullivan and his 12-year-old son escape and embark upon a life-changing journey of revenge.

programme.title: Archie
programme.desc: Cary overcomes his fears and phobias and ties the knot for a fourth time with Dyan Cannon and they are soon thrilled with the arrival of his first child Jennifer in 1966. But at 62, Cary struggles with the responsibilities of being a parent after an all-too-short honeymoon period and becomes controlling again

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Love Your Friday with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Continuing his stroll down memory lane, Alan revisits a 2020 episode of Love Your Weekend with interviews with comedian Hugh Dennis and TV star Lesley Joseph. Plus, there's a trip to an allotment in Ilkley which is where the host grew up

programme.title: Inside Britain's Food Factories
programme.desc: The documentary goes behind the scenes of three factories in Yorkshire. It reveals how Aunt Bessie's produces millions of Yorkshire puddings a year, how Yorkshire Tea turn out teabags by the truckload and how Birds Eye workers face a race against time to get their peas from field to freezer. Narrated by Siobhan Finneran

programme.title: Fletchers' Family Farm at Christmas
programme.desc: Kelvin, Liz and the family head to Finland for a seasonal special, visiting a family farm thriving in the harsh conditions of the Arctic Circle. The Fletchers dive into the magic of a Nordic winter by enjoying traditional activities and meeting the animals that flourish in this frosty wilderness to make their Finnish adventure one the family will never forget

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Joining Alan at Manor Farm are actress Sophie Thompson, and TV presenter JJ Chalmers, who talks about his friendship with the Duke of Sussex. Plus, horticulturalist Camilla Bassett Smith opens her January diary, and Aleesha Hansell discusses the British white wines causing a stir

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James welcomes in 2025 by serving up a feast of delicious recipes for broadcaster Gloria Hunniford and enjoying dishes from fellow chefs Galton Blackiston and Tommy Banks

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott return with more recipes, beginning by exploring the flavours of the Middle East, starting with chicken torsh, a traditional sweet and sour Persian kebab. Lisa Snowdon pays a visit to Nilly's Turkish to find out what makes her wraps so popular, before cooking up her own dish inspired by the flavours she finds. Back in the kitchen, Ainsley is joined by Kate Lawler, who whips up a mega salad and has a secret halloumi hack

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef visits the Languedoc region, famous for its wine and the hearty, meaty dish cassoulet, and stops at a roadside fruit stall owned by a couple of British expats, before creating an unusual dish using melon and onion rings. He meets a modest chef who prepares a mouth-watering cassoulet, before staying at an 18th-century coach house and visiting a museum dedicated to Citroen 2CVs

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Sandown
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the Veterans' Chase at Sandown Park, plus racing from Wincanton. With analysis from Mick Fitzgerald and Leonna Mayor, reports by Alice Plunkett and Oli Bell, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Julia Goulding, Oz Clarke, Laura Hamilton and Mr Motivator pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Graham Norton returns with the game show in which contestants compete to solve word puzzles to get the chance to spin the wheel and win big money prizes, with accountant John, primary school teacher Jess and care home assistant Paris trying to win a potential jackpot of £50,000

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett is back with the singing contest in which the celebrity panel must guess the famous faces performing behind elaborate costumes. Returning panellists Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Mo Gilligan are joined by Maya Jama, and this opening episode sees the first six of the 12 mystery celebrities battling it out as Teeth, Snail, Tattoo, Kingfisher, Spag Bol and Dressed Crab take to the stage

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win
programme.desc: Return of the quiz hosted by the duo in which contestants get the chance to win the biggest cash prize in British TV history with a limitless jackpot. First up are Joe and sister-in-law Jo, who have been prepping by going round the supermarket sizing things up with a tape measure, followed by Steve and son-in-law Jordan, who hope their approach will help propel them into the truly life-changing sums of money on the ladder

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: The death of 19-year-old Sophie Chalcott, the daughter of the UK minister for trade, sparks international interest after her body is found floating in Sydney harbour the morning after a lavish party on a boat. British detective Max Drummond arrives in Sydney to find a complex homicide investigation under way and clashes immediately with DS Meg Driscoll on her first murder case as lead detective. Thriller, starring John Bradley, Joanne Froggatt and Kirsty Sturgess

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Life and Death of Lily Savage
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady became a much-loved fixture of TV and radio. However, for more than 20 years he was a razor-tongued drag queen. Set against the backdrop of Margaret Thatcher's Britain, Clause 28 and the Aids crisis, this is the story of the star through the prism of his famous creation, Lily Savage. The documentary features Paul's closest friends and family, including his daughter Sharyn Mousley and sister Sheila Rudd, and interviews with Ian McKellen, Julian Clary, Jo Brand, Alan Carr and Graham Norton among others

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, including Blackburn Rovers v Burnley at Ewood Park, Hull City v Leeds United at MKM Stadium and Watford v Sheffield United at Vicarage Road in the Championship

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: The death of 19-year-old Sophie Chalcott, the daughter of the UK minister for trade, sparks international interest after her body is found floating in Sydney harbour the morning after a lavish party on a boat. British detective Max Drummond arrives in Sydney to find a complex homicide investigation under way and clashes immediately with DS Meg Driscoll on her first murder case as lead detective. Thriller, starring John Bradley, Joanne Froggatt and Kirsty Sturgess

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James welcomes in 2025 by serving up a feast of delicious recipes for broadcaster Gloria Hunniford and enjoying dishes from fellow chefs Galton Blackiston and Tommy Banks

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined by actress and comedian Kerry Godliman and actor Martin Shaw, while horticulturists Camilla Bassett Smith and Jamie Butterworth join forces to tackle a new year garden challenge and landscape artist Chris Cyprus creates a new masterpiece for the barn. Plus, social media star Sam Wolfenden shares his passion for farriery, there is bird-spotting with wildlife expert David Lindo, and Ian Burrell is back behind the bar serving up the very best winter rum cocktails

programme.title: Fletchers' Family Farm
programme.desc: The big day arrives as the Fletchers compete in the Royal Cheshire Show with their cows Cherry and Sonic, but with only four weeks of cow ownership under their belts, how well will they do? Marnie's calf starts playing up as he becomes overwhelmed by the noise of the crowd, while Milo enters the young handler contest, and emotions are high for Kelvin and Liz as the show comes to a close

programme.title: The Royal Beat
programme.desc: Kate Thornton is joined by journalists Roya Nikkhah, Russell Myers and Emily Nash to discuss all of the latest news surrounding the royal family

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Goonies
programme.desc: Adventure based on a story by Steven Spielberg, starring Sean Astin, Corey Feldman and Martha Plimpton. While clearing out an attic, a gang of boys known as the "Goonies" come across a map revealing the location of a long-lost galleon. But when they begin their search for the vessel, they find the evil Mama Fratelli standing in the way of a fantastic adventure.

programme.title: Sing 2
programme.desc: Animated musical comedy featuring the voices of Matthew McConaughey, Reese Witherspoon and Scarlett Johansson. Music promoter Buster Moon books a major show for his singing troupe - but only on the proviso that he can track down and hire a reclusive rock legend.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts as the remaining six incognito celebrities enter the competition, with Pufferfish, Bush, Wolf, Pegasus, Toad in the Hole and Bear taking to the stage. Special guest Vicky McClure joins panellists Maya Jama, Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Mo Gilligan and the true identity of one of the disguised famous faces is revealed at the end of the show

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win
programme.desc: Steve is back to finish his game with son-in-law Jordan, hoping to win enough money to get him and step-daughter Megan out of the house and set them up with a home of their own. Husband-and-wife team Richard and Lorna then face the Limitless Ladder looking to win some major money - they've been doing some proper homework, but can they translate it into hard cash?

programme.title: Playing Nice
programme.desc: Pete and Maddie find out that their son Theo was swapped at birth with another boy in a hospital mix-up. Will Theo's real parents want him back or will the couples be able to sort things out amicably? Psychological thriller adapted from the best-selling novel by JP Delaney, starring James Norton, Niamh Algar, James McArdle and Jessica Brown Findlay

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: No Time to Die
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Daniel Craig, Rami Malek and Léa Seydoux. After narrowly surviving an attempt on his life, James Bond believes his lover, Madeleine Swann, has betrayed him. Five years later, he is drawn out of retirement and back into her life when a new global threat - a deadly biological weapon - emerges. But with Bond's nemesis, Blofeld, behind bars, who is the mysterious figure intent on using this terrifying new technology?

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents action from Brands Hatch GP, with racing from the Porsche Sprint Challenge Great Britain and the ROKiT F4 British Championship

programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Lorraine

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Looking back at some of the most dramatic end games in Tipping history, including agonising trades and jackpot counters teetering on the edge...

programme.title: Pictionary
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts the game show where two teams of three players compete against each other trying to guess the correct word or phrase represented by the drawings of their team-mates. Mel is joined by Denise Van Outen and Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen as the players draw and their team members guess

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts the quiz in which three pairs of contestants use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords, with the last remaining duo having the opportunity to double the money they've banked. This edition features sisters Moina and Shazia, Ashleigh and her dad Brent, and couple Ian and Laura

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show as contestant Alex tries to open the 22 red boxes in the right order, taking on the infamous Banker for the chance to win a life-changing cash prize

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Mark from Widnes, Cat from Leeds, Elliot from Manchester and Doyin from London pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Suspicious Dawn points the finger, Rhona is still upset with Marlon, and Jacob is overwhelmed

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: With Betsy still refusing to believe in his innocence, Mason prepares to leave Weatherfield to escape his brothers. However, Matty and Logan soon track him down, and Dylan and Abi get caught in the fallout

programme.title: Playing Nice
programme.desc: Pete and Maddie begin the fight to keep Theo, but it's an expensive and painful process and the constant dredging up of their past starts to damage their relationship. Can they survive? Psychological thriller adapted from the best-selling novel by JP Delaney, starring James Norton, Niamh Algar, James McArdle and Jessica Brown Findlay

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: Mr Bates vs the Post Office: The Impact
programme.desc: In January 2024, the drama series Mr Bates vs The Post Office brought the story of the faulty Horizon computer and the subpostmasters wrongfully accused of theft to a national audience. In this follow-up documentary, the former subpostmasters and subpostmistresses involved talk about the impact of the drama, while more come forward to tell their heart-breaking stories for the first time. Narrated by Toby Jones

programme.title: Inside Britain's Food Factories
programme.desc: The documentary goes behind the scenes of three factories in Yorkshire. programme.title: The Life and Death of Lily Savage
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady became a much-loved fixture of TV and radio. However, for more than 20 years he was a razor-tongued drag queen. Set against the backdrop of Margaret Thatcher's Britain, Clause 28 and the Aids crisis, this is the story of the star through the prism of his famous creation, Lily Savage. The documentary features Paul's closest friends and family, including his daughter Sharyn Mousley and sister Sheila Rudd, and interviews with Ian McKellen, Julian Clary, Jo Brand, Alan Carr and Graham Norton among others

programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Julia Goulding, Oz Clarke, Laura Hamilton and Mr Motivator pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Graham Norton returns with the game show in which contestants compete to solve word puzzles to get the chance to spin the wheel and win big money prizes, with accountant John, primary school teacher Jess and care home assistant Paris trying to win a potential jackpot of £50,000

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett is back with the singing contest in which the celebrity panel must guess the famous faces performing behind elaborate costumes. Returning panellists Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Mo Gilligan are joined by Maya Jama, and this opening episode sees the first six of the 12 mystery celebrities battling it out as Teeth, Snail, Tattoo, Kingfisher, Spag Bol and Dressed Crab take to the stage

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win
programme.desc: Return of the quiz hosted by the duo in which contestants get the chance to win the biggest cash prize in British TV history with a limitless jackpot. First up are Joe and sister-in-law Jo, who have been prepping by going round the supermarket sizing things up with a tape measure, followed by Steve and son-in-law Jordan, who hope their approach will help propel them into the truly life-changing sums of money on the ladder

programme.title: North Shore
programme.desc: The death of 19-year-old Sophie Chalcott, the daughter of the UK minister for trade, sparks international interest after her body is found floating in Sydney harbour the morning after a lavish party on a boat. British detective Max Drummond arrives in Sydney to find a complex homicide investigation under way and clashes immediately with DS Meg Driscoll on her first murder case as lead detective. Thriller, starring John Bradley, Joanne Froggatt and Kirsty Sturgess

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Life and Death of Lily Savage
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady became a much-loved fixture of TV and radio. However, for more than 20 years he was a razor-tongued drag queen. Set against the backdrop of Margaret Thatcher's Britain, Clause 28 and the Aids crisis, this is the story of the star through the prism of his famous creation, Lily Savage. The documentary features Paul's closest friends and family, including his daughter Sharyn Mousley and sister Sheila Rudd, and interviews with Ian McKellen, Julian Clary, Jo Brand, Alan Carr and Graham Norton among others

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, including Blackburn Rovers v Burnley at Ewood Park, Hull City v Leeds United at MKM Stadium and Watford v Sheffield United at Vicarage Road in the Championship

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott return with more recipes, beginning by exploring the flavours of the Middle East, starting with chicken torsh, a traditional sweet and sour Persian kebab. Lisa Snowdon pays a visit to Nilly's Turkish to find out what makes her wraps so popular, before cooking up her own dish inspired by the flavours she finds. Back in the kitchen, Ainsley is joined by Kate Lawler, who whips up a mega salad and has a secret halloumi hack

programme.title: The Masked Singer

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined by actress and comedian Kerry Godliman and actor Martin Shaw, while horticulturists Camilla Bassett Smith and Jamie Butterworth join forces to tackle a new year garden challenge and landscape artist Chris Cyprus creates a new masterpiece for the barn. Plus, social media star Sam Wolfenden shares his passion for farriery, there is bird-spotting with wildlife expert David Lindo, and Ian Burrell is back behind the bar serving up the very best winter rum cocktails

programme.title: Fletchers' Family Farm
programme.desc: The big day arrives as the Fletchers compete in the Royal Cheshire Show with their cows Cherry and Sonic, but with only four weeks of cow ownership under their belts, how well will they do? Marnie's calf starts playing up as he becomes overwhelmed by the noise of the crowd, while Milo enters the young handler contest, and emotions are high for Kelvin and Liz as the show comes to a close

programme.title: The Goonies
programme.desc: Adventure based on a story by Steven Spielberg, starring Sean Astin, Corey Feldman and Martha Plimpton. While clearing out an attic, a gang of boys known as the "Goonies" come across a map revealing the location of a long-lost galleon. But when they begin their search for the vessel, they find the evil Mama Fratelli standing in the way of a fantastic adventure.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win

programme.title: Playing Nice
programme.desc: Pete and Maddie find out that their son Theo was swapped at birth with another boy in a hospital mix-up. Five years later, he is drawn out of retirement and back into her life when a new global threat - a deadly biological weapon - emerges. But with Bond's nemesis, Blofeld, behind bars, who is the mysterious figure intent on using this terrifying new technology?
